qualitative_description: The C++ candidate implements a standard, mechanistic NPZ structure but does not exactly match the TRUTH model. It uses a Monod/Michaelis-Menten nutrient limitation for phytoplankton growth and a Holling Type II grazing functional response (both common literature alternates), with assimilation efficiency converting grazed P into Z and recycling via mortality and unassimilated grazing. It omits the TRUTH model's P-dependent light/attenuation factor (a/(b + c*P) or the P^2 Type-III grazing) and also omits an explicit nutrient mixing/entrainment term of the form k*(N0-N). The candidate adds an explicit quadratic (density-dependent) zooplankton mortality term not present in TRUTH. Numerical/implementation differences (discrete forward update, eps lower bounds, observation-likelihood machinery) are present but not ecological processes.

nutrient_equation_uptake.explanation: Candidate: growth_rate = r * N_prev / (K_N + N_prev); P_growth = growth_rate * P_prev * dt; N_pred decrement: N_pred = N_prev - P_growth + ... — i.e. uptake = - r * N/(K_N+N) * P. TRUTH uptake uses (N/(e+N))*(a/(b+c*P))*P which contains an extra P-dependent attenuation factor; candidate uses classic Monod (Michaelis-Menten) form instead.

nutrient_equation_recycling.matched_form: recycling via mortality and unassimilated grazing
nutrient_equation_recycling.explanation: Candidate recycles to N by adding P_mortality and Z_mortality and unassimilated grazing: N_pred = N_prev - P_growth + P_mortality + Z_mortality + (Type(1.0) - e) * P_grazed; where P_mortality = m_P * P_prev * dt and Z_mortality = m_Z*Z_prev*dt + m_Z2*Z_prev*Z_prev*dt. TRUTH recycles via several specific terms (e.g. r*P, beta*lambda_*P^2/(mu^2+P^2)*Z, gamma*q*Z) — candidate implements recycling as mortality + unassimilated fraction, an alternate but ecologically equivalent recycling pathway.

nutrient_equation_mixing.explanation: No explicit mixing/entrainment term appears in N_pred (no equivalent of TRUTH's k*(N0 - N)). N_pred update = N_prev - P_growth + P_mortality + Z_mortality + (1-e)*P_grazed; mixing term absent.

phytoplankton_equation_growth.explanation: Candidate: growth_rate = r * N_prev / (K_N + N_prev); P_growth = growth_rate * P_prev * dt; P_pred includes + P_growth. TRUTH growth uses (N/(e+N))*(a/(b+c*P))*P, i.e. Monod-like N-limitation but with an extra a/(b+c*P) factor — candidate uses classic Monod (Michaelis-Menten) form (alternate).

phytoplankton_equation_grazing_loss.explanation: Candidate defines grazing_rate = g_max * P_prev / (K_P + P_prev); P_grazed = grazing_rate * Z_prev * dt; P_pred subtracts P_grazed. TRUTH uses lambda_ * P^2/(mu^2+P^2) * Z (a Type-III / sigmoid P^2 form). Candidate uses Holling II (saturating with exponent 1), an alternate functional form.

phytoplankton_equation_mortality.explanation: Candidate: P_mortality = m_P * P_prev * dt; P_pred subtracts P_mortality. TRUTH has linear losses (s + k)*P in dP/dt; candidate uses a single linear mortality term m_P (an alternate but equivalent representation).

phytoplankton_equation_mixing.explanation: No explicit mixing/entrainment term for P (TRUTH has -(s + k)*P where k includes mixing). Candidate P_pred update lacks any term representing physical mixing/entrainment.

zooplankton_equation_growth.explanation: Candidate: Z_growth = e * P_grazed; with P_grazed = grazing_rate * Z_prev * dt where grazing_rate = g_max * P/(K_P+P). Z_pred adds Z_growth. TRUTH uses alpha * lambda_ * P^2/(mu^2+P^2) * Z (a P^2 Type-III growth term). Candidate uses assimilation efficiency times Holling-II grazing — an alternate but standard formulation.

zooplankton_equation_mortality.explanation: Candidate includes two mortality components: Z_mortality_linear = m_Z * Z_prev * dt and Z_mortality_quadratic = m_Z2 * Z_prev * Z_prev * dt; Z_mortality = linear + quadratic; Z_pred subtracts Z_mortality. TRUTH has only linear loss q*Z. Quadratic mortality is listed in the literature alternates, so this is an alternate (but richer) form.

zooplankton_equation_mixing.explanation: No explicit mixing/entrainment term for Z appears. TRUTH does not include an explicit Z mixing either, but the rubric requests checking presence: candidate has no mixing term for zooplankton (no k*(Z0 - Z) or similar).

extra_components_description: 1) Quadratic zooplankton mortality (m_Z2 * Z^2): an explicit density-dependent zooplankton loss term representing higher-trophic predation or intraspecific density dependence, not present in the TRUTH NPZ.
